intro: Chamaemelum grossheimii, commonly known as the California goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in full sun. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant has a low, spreading growth habit. Chamaemelum grossheimii is also known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
